definition: to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to bare
old variant of 袒[tan3]
to protect

sentences.english: The most watched development. of course. is the threat of trcommerciinge protectionism.
sentences.chinese: 当然，最有目共睹的进展是贸易袒护主义的威迫。

sentences.english: "I will not shield my child," the elder Li said.
sentences.chinese: “我不会袒护我的儿子的，”李刚说道。

sentences.english: Your son suffers from your excessive shielding.
sentences.chinese: 你的过分袒护，反而害了你的儿子。

sentences.english: The stain "is" cover "martial peace again after feature-length works.
sentences.chinese: 《污点》是武和平《袒护》之后又一部长篇力作。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Saudis in general dislike what they see as America’s bias towards Israel.
sentences.chinese: 同时，沙特对美国袒护以色列也很有看法。

sentences.english: I convergence in my hands and feet, to protect, but difficult to avoid grounding.
sentences.chinese: 我收敛我的手脚，极力袒护，但还是要难避磨砺。

definition: to shield/to harbor/to cover up
to bare one shoulder/(fig.) to side with/to discriminate in favor of
to defend sb (a relative, friend or oneself) despite knowing that that person is in the wrong
to incite/to stir up/to instigate
to lash out/to reprimand
unable to distinguish right and wrong (idiom)
to protect a croney/to give unprincipled support
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to indulge/to connive at
to stick up for a wrongdoer
to contradict (elders or superiors)
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
to slander/to smear/to tarnish
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
